meanings.definition: To emit radiation in a different direction.
meanings.sent1: The sun was reradiating warmth towards the Earth.
meanings.sent2: The mirror reradiated the light in a new angle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept reradiating the laser pointer beam all over the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reradiated joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The campfire reradiated a cozy glow, inviting everyone to gather around.

meanings.definition: To reflect or scatter radiation in various directions.
meanings.sent1: The shiny surface reradiated the sunlight in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The atmosphere reradiated the incoming heat back into space.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball was reradiating light in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm reradiated through the team, boosting morale.
meanings.sent5: The gemstone reradiated a rainbow of colors when light hit it.
